title: Lancer 25 PS
text:
The Lancer 25 PS is an American <a href="Trailer%20sailer">trailerable</a> <a href="sailboat">sailboat</a> that was designed by <a href="Herb%20David">Herb David</a> as a <a href="motorsailer">motorsailer</a> and first built in 1985. The "PS" designation stands for "Power Sailer".
The Lancer 25 PS has a different hull shape from the <a href="Lancer%2025">Lancer 25</a> and the <a href="Lancer%2025%20Mark%20V">Lancer 25 Mark V</a>.
Production.
The design was built by <a href="Lancer%20Yachts">Lancer Yachts</a> in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, starting in 1985, but it is now out of production.
Design.
The Lancer 25 PS is a recreational <a href="keelboat">keelboat</a>, built predominantly of <a href="fiberglass">fiberglass</a>, with wood trim. It has a <a href="Fractional%20rig">fractional</a> <a href="sloop">sloop</a> rig, a <a href="raked%20stem">raked stem</a>, an angled <a href="Transom%20%28nautical%29">transom</a>, an internally mounted spade-type <a href="rudder">rudder</a> controlled by a <a href="Ship%27s%20wheel">wheel</a> and a fixed fin <a href="keel">keel</a>. It displaces and carries of ballast. The boat has a draft of with the standard keel.
As a motorsailer, the boat is normally fitted with a large <a href="outboard%20motor">outboard motor</a>.
The design has sleeping accommodation for four people, with a double "V"-berth in the bow cabin around a drop-table and an aft cabin with a transversal double berth. The <a href="Galley%20%28kitchen%29">galley</a> is located on the starboard side just forward of the <a href="companionway">companionway</a> ladder. The galley is equipped with a stove, <a href="icebox">icebox</a> and a sink. The <a href="Head%20%28watercraft%29">head</a> is located opposite the galley on the port side and includes a shower. The fresh water tank has a capacity of .
